descriptions: Fails to identify any potential dangers in given situations.
Identifies a few obvious dangers but misses several key risks.
Identifies some potential dangers with limited detail or accuracy.
Identifies most potential dangers with reasonable accuracy and detail.
Identifies almost all potential dangers with good accuracy and detail.
Thoroughly identifies all potential dangers with excellent accuracy, providing comprehensive detail and insight.
Unable to suggest any strategies to avoid dangerous situations.
Suggests strategies that are inappropriate or ineffective in avoiding danger.
Suggests strategies to avoid danger, but they are simplistic or not fully thought out.
Suggests effective strategies to avoid danger, but lacks depth in explaining why they work.
Suggests well-reasoned and effective strategies to avoid danger with clear explanations.
Presents comprehensive and innovative strategies to avoid danger, demonstrating a deep understanding of risk mitigation.
Shows no understanding of the potential consequences of dangerous situations.
Demonstrates limited awareness of the possible outcomes of risky behaviors.
Shows some understanding of consequences, but the connection to specific actions is weak.
Understands the consequences of dangerous situations and relates them to specific choices.
Clearly understands and articulates the consequences of dangerous situations, providing relevant examples.
Demonstrates a sophisticated understanding of consequences, including long-term and indirect impacts, with insightful analysis.
